Immortality could lead to overpopulation, as people would have more time to reproduce and live without the fear of death. This could lead to strain on resources and environmental degradation.

It could lead to a society where people no longer value life, as death is no longer a natural part of the human experience. This could lead to a lack of empathy and a disregard for the well-being of others.
It could lead to a society where people are no longer motivated to achieve, as they have all the time in the world. This could lead to a lack of innovation and progress.
It could lead to a society where people become complacent and lazy, as they have all the time in the world to do nothing. This could lead to a lack of motivation and a lack of drive.

It could lead to a society where people are no longer able to grieve, as death is no longer a natural part of the human experience. This could lead to a lack of emotional depth and a lack of understanding of the human condition.
